title: Neural Network / ML Inference Engines Audit

architecture.weight_format: Flat arrays per layer with dimension validation

activations.note: Sigmoid clamp to [-500, 500] is a good safety measure against numerical overflow

inference_pipeline.weight_validation: Validates weight count matches layer dimensions
inference_pipeline.note: Inference-only — weights must be pre-trained externally

confidence_metric.sigmoid_output: distance from 0.5 scaled to [0,1] — reasonable binary confidence
confidence_metric.multi_output: softmax of top class — standard ML confidence
confidence_metric.single_output_linear: defaults to 1.0 — no uncertainty estimate for regression
confidence_metric.note: No input normalization or output denormalization — user must provide pre-normalized features

algorithms_audited.name: EnsemblePredictorModel
algorithms_audited.approach: Multi-algorithm fusion: weighted average, voting, best-objective

best_objective.method: Select feasible solution with best objective value

consensus.agreement_metric: Strategy-dependent (CV for avg, vote ratio for voting)

split_criteria.note: Both criteria correctly implemented with configurable selection

feature_importance.method: Impurity reduction weighted by sample proportion

algorithms_audited.name: ClusteringEngine
algorithms_audited.approach: K-Means++ with elbow method and silhouette scoring

initialization.note: Correct D² sampling for initial centroid placement

auto_k.method: Elbow method via max second derivative of inertia
auto_k.note: Correct elbow detection using curvature analysis

smoothing.note: Standard Holt method — correct level and trend update

forecasting.method: Level + h × trend with growing uncertainty bands
forecasting.uncertainty: RMSE × sqrt(h) × z — correct fan-out prediction interval

diagnostics.trend_direction: Classified vs RMSE threshold — good practice

algorithms_audited.name: AnomalyDetector
algorithms_audited.approach: SPC Shewhart chart with Western Electric + Nelson rules

control_limits.sigma: Sample standard deviation (n-1 denominator) — correct Bessel correction

western_electric_rules.rule_2: 2 of 3 consecutive beyond ±2σ same side → warning
western_electric_rules.rule_3: 4 of 5 consecutive beyond ±1σ same side → warning
western_electric_rules.rule_4: 8 consecutive points on same side of mean → warning
western_electric_rules.note: All 4 WE rules correctly implemented with deduplication

nelson_rules.note: Optional Nelson rule for monotonic trends

cpk.note: Correct Cpk for centered process — uses control limits as spec limits

findings.finding: NeuralInference: Correct forward-pass MLP with 4 activations and sigmoid overflow protection
EnsemblePredictorModel: 3 fusion strategies (avg/vote/best) correctly handle 7 problem types
DecisionTreeClassifier: CART with Gini/entropy, feature importance, and configurable depth
ClusteringEngine: K-Means++ initialization + elbow method + silhouette scoring — complete pipeline
TimeSeriesPredictor: Holt double exponential smoothing with correct level/trend update equations
AnomalyDetector: All 4 Western Electric rules + Nelson Rule 5 correctly implemented with deduplication
All 6 algorithms implement Algorithm<I,O> interface consistently
NeuralInference is inference-only (no training). Weights must be pre-trained externally — appropriate for embedded manufacturing use.
AnomalyDetector Cpk uses control limits as spec limits. For true Cpk, external USL/LSL should be provided. Acceptable for SPC monitoring.
NeuralInference has no input normalization or output denormalization. Users must pre-normalize features externally. Manufacturing sensor data varies widely in scale.
NeuralInference confidence for single linear output defaults to 1.0 — no uncertainty quantification for regression-style predictions.
